column4: This technology encompasses advanced wearable materials and flexible sensor systems designed for continuous health and physiological monitoring. By integrating soft materials, low-power sensors, and data acquisition modules, these platforms enable real-time tracking of human health metrics and support remote, preventive, and personalized healthcare applications.

column3: Human–Computer Interaction (HCI) · Digital Services · UX Technologies
column4: This technology focuses on understanding user behavior, intent, and experience to enable intuitive, accessible, and effective interaction between humans and digital systems. It leverages user modeling, interaction design, and behavioral analysis to improve usability, decision-making, and user trust across digital platforms.

This technology includes neural, bio-integrated, and multimodal interfaces that enable direct interaction between biological systems and digital devices. It supports the recording, stimulation, and interpretation of neural and physiological signals across multiple modalities, enabling advanced therapeutic, rehabilitative, and human–machine interface applications.

column3: Artificial Intelligence · Data Science · Advanced Analytics
column4: This technology applies deep learning and spatiotemporal modeling techniques to analyze complex, dynamic data and generate predictive insights. It enables pattern recognition, forecasting, and decision support across time-dependent and spatially distributed systems, serving as a core analytical engine for intelligent applications.

This technology integrates robotics, control algorithms, and human-centered AI to support, enhance, or restore human capabilities. It focuses on safe, adaptive, and collaborative systems that assist human movement, interaction, and decision-making in healthcare, rehabilitation, and physically demanding environments.
